messages.content:
Hi, I have several questions that are related, so I will 
post them together, sorry if it's a lot. 

1. When I send a transaction, it enters the "pending" stage. 
According to https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps/o1js-reference/type-aliases/TransactionStatus, it becomes "included" once it is included
in a block that is part of the longest chain - does this mean 
there has to be another block after this one? Does that mean 
a transaction interacting with the deployed contract can first
appear in the block after the deployment transaction or in the
second one after it?

2. From my understanding, when creating a zkApp that I need to
initialise, I need to wait for the deployment transaction to first
be "included" is this correct? 

3. If so, from my understanding, an "included" transaction is still 
not 100% final, what happens if I create another transaction that 
interacts with the zkApp created, but whose deployment transaction 
has ultimately been rejected?

4. I would also like to ask whether there exists a table similar 
to https://docs.minaprotocol.com/mina-protocol/lifecycle-of-a-payment, concerning the finality confidence after each block
after the one in which a transaction is included?

What I am trying to do is create a graph to show how long it takes
to deploy, initialise, and ultimately interact with a zkApp in terms
of blocks and raw time, as well as in terms of setting the fees to 
make this time shortest possible.

1. No
2. No
3. Depends on what the block producer decides to do, who takes fees into account 
4. Finality is the exact same as on Bitcoin and Cardano
